title: KK Ibar
text:
KK Ibar is a professional basketball club from <a href="Ro%C5%BEaje">Rožaje</a>, <a href="Montenegro">Montenegro</a>. The team currently competes in the <a href="First%20Montenegrin%20Opportunity%20League">Erste Basketball League</a>. They gained their status of a first division team by winning the second division league <a href="Prva%20B%20Liga">Prva B Liga</a> in 2011/12. The club also competes in all leagues for younger players.
History.
KK Ibar was founded in 1981. by Faruk Tabaković and Faruk Kalić in <a href="Ro%C5%BEaje">Rožaje</a>, <a href="SFR%20Yugoslavia">SFR Yugoslavia</a>.
The club doesn't have huge successes in their history. The biggest success of the senior team is the title of <a href="Prva%20B%20Liga">Prva B Liga</a> Championship in 2012. and the 2012/13 placement in the quarter final of the Montenegrin Cup.
Sports Center.
<a href="Sports%20Center%20Ro%C5%BEaje">Sports Center Rožaje</a> (Bosnian/Montenegrin: Sportski centar Rožaje) is a sport center located in <a href="Ro%C5%BEaje">Rožaje</a>, <a href="Montenegro">Montenegro</a>.
The sports center is located on Bandžovo Brdo, next to the main city football stadium. Construction of this sports complex began in 2006. The director is Rešid Pepić. The complex was created by the decision of The Municipal Assembly of Rožaje number 1383 from 10.07.2006. The main activity of the complex is the management and maintenance of sports facilities as well as:
The main arena is built for various sports, such as:
Supporters.
Ibar fans are known as <a href="Gazije">Gazije</a> (Arabic: ghāzī or ghazah/gazi, from ghazw, pl. ghazawāt, armed incursion with the intention of conquering - Gazije were the defenders of Islam (Islamic fighters) in the period of the Ottoman Empire). The group is founded in 1996. The group's traditional colours are black and white, which are also the colours of the football club <a href="FK%20Ibar">FK Ibar</a> where Gazije first started giving their support. After the football club failed to reach the First Montenegrin League in 2006., 2007. and 2008., the footballers lost the support of fans since they failed to win the away play-off match against <a href="FK%20De%C4%8Di%C4%87">FK Dečić</a> for the First league placement. The basketball club was first time supported by a big group of supporters in the first matches of Erste League.
Notable players.
In the short history of the basketball club Ibar from <a href="Ro%C5%BEaje">Rožaje</a>, the best players who played for the club are from the team which lead this team to the First Montenegrin league in front with Mersudin Kušuta. Most of those players play still in the club. In the first appearances as a top league team, one of the most notable players was Brandon Roberson from the United States who left the club after the first half of the season 2012/2013.
